Seems to be a nice number of people here from Texas :)

  ----- Original Me=
ssage ----- 
  From: Jon 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, Fe=
bruary 15, 2009 11:52 AM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Hey Golden Phoenix


  GP, I =
am glad to see you are here, a friendly face from close by. I am
  also gla=
d to see that this site is not all negative. I had just
  joined last week,=
 and made the post about the Door to the Dead; and
  with all the negative =
post was thinking about leaving this forum. In
  fact I had e-mailed Larry =
privately expressing that thought.

  I have seen a rash of e-mails more up=
 beat so I have gone back to
  individual e-mails from the digest. I think =
I will hang around a
  little longer.

  For other members in Texas, I'm in=
 Houston, just across the channel
  from the Golden Phoenix. I see we are w=
ell represented as a state. I
  am glad to meet all of you.

  Regards,
  J=
on in Texas

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Golden Phoenix <golden_phoen=
ix42@...>
  wrote:
  >
  > not to bad for an old man here. not much happeni=
ng around here but
  home repairs.
  >  
  > http://www.myspace.com/ghost_h=
unter50 see my site links
  > 
  > --- On Sat, 2/14/09, Larry Weinreich <LW=
EINREICH@...> wrote:

 =
 > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Door To The Dead

  > Hey Jeff!!!!
  >   Nice to see ya again :) Hows it going down th=
ere? Elly and the
  others from across the pond send their wish's :) You me=
...I always say
  what I feel.
  >               Larry
  >

  > From: laurie@ste=
uber. com <laurie@steuber. com>
  > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Door To The Dead=

  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
  > Date: Saturday, February 14, 2009, 12=
:42 PM
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > I agree, Larry! (and I am a psychic, lo=
l)
  > I did not watch the show because my group and I were actually out
  =
investigating  something last night. As it is we are very busy with
  cases=
, box research and other research and projects. We do not,
  therefore, hav=
e time to watch other people,often pathetic wanna-be
  famous para-celebs, =
pretend to be what we really are.
  >  
  > I wrote a blog about this whole=
 thing - in this field, thos that can
  do..those that can't sit and watch =
others pretend to do ti on TV.
  >  
  > Laurie
  > -----Original Message--=
---
  > From: "Larry Weinreich" <LWEINREICH@satx. rr.com>
  > Sent: Saturda=
y, February 14, 2009 1:35pm
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
  > Subject: R=
e: [EVP-ITC] Door To The Dead
  > 
  > 
  > I find most paranormal shows ha=
ve become BS and I don't watch any.
  Its all the same "dog and pony" act. =
Since "Ghost Hunters" has become
  a hit "everyone" wants their own tv show=
 or radio show. Its all "look
  at me".
  >                  Sorry I'm very=
 jaded on tv paranormal
  investigators, mediums and evangelists on Sunday =
mornings. In my book
  they all rank just a bit above lawyers but still bel=
ow pro wrestling.
  >   (Hows that for an introduction?  :)  )
  >         =
          Larry
  >  
  > 
  > ----- Original Message ----- 
  > From: John=
 S 
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
  > Sent: Saturday, February 14, 2009=
 9:44 AM
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Door To The Dead
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
 =
 > 
  > I have to admit that I thought I had seen the worst 'paranormal'
  =
show on television already. I was wrong. Door to the Dead has exceeded
  my=
 worst expectations.
  >  
  > Generally, I respect John Oliver's work as a=
 medium. While I have no
  personal experience with him, in the past he has=
 looked and acted more
  genuine than not, the rolling of the eyes put asid=
e for the moment.
  >  
  > I do take exception to the characterization of =
the talking box as an
  Edison device. I have documented the history of Edi=
son, ITC and
  EVP  elsewhere. This is however the smallest concern I have =
with this
  show.
  >  
  > Prior to wathcing I had just had a conversation=
 with a respected
  colleague on the West coast regarding interesting pheno=
mena he and
  others are constantly observing in sites with phenomena simil=
ar to
  that on Door to the Dead. None of those measurements were made by t=
his
  team. The use of thermal in this situation is not indicated as well.
=
  >  
  > The real concern is that no attempt was made to help this family =
in
  a broader context. The skeptic did and said nothing skeptical as far
 =
 as I could tell. Key questions were not asked (at least on-camera)
  that =
would reveal the psycho-dynamics of this family. We know fairly
  well at t=
his time that PK phenomena is often centered on a focal
  person who can ex=
hibit specific characteristics. That the team seems
  unaware of this is qu=
ite disturbing to a person like myself.
  >  
  > A real research opportuni=
ty was lost in this case, as was an
  opportunity to educate the public on =
the right way to approach such
  situations. Continually sending the messag=
es that phenomena is based
  on 'demons' and 'spirits' exclusively does not=
hing to further the
  position of serious investigators, which is perhaps m=
ost troubling of all.
  >
